dailyTip.title: Tip of the day
dailyTip.tip1: Customize your cover letter for each application. Recruiters appreciate candidates who show genuine interest in their company.
dailyTip.tip2: Use relevant keywords in your CV related to the job offer. It improves your chances of being spotted by automatic screening systems.
dailyTip.tip3: Prepare 3-4 relevant questions to ask at the end of the interview. It shows your interest in the position and company.
dailyTip.tip4: Create an online portfolio to showcase your achievements and projects. A link in your CV can make a difference.
dailyTip.tip5: Follow companies you are interested in on LinkedIn. It keeps you informed about their news and opportunities.
dailyTip.tip6: Politely follow up on your applications after 1-2 weeks without a response. A simple message can revive your file.
dailyTip.tip7: Adapt your CV for each position by highlighting the most relevant skills for the offer.
dailyTip.tip8: Prepare concrete examples of your achievements using the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result).
dailyTip.tip9: Optimize your LinkedIn profile with a professional photo and catchy summary. It is often the first contact with recruiters.
dailyTip.tip10: Practice presenting your background in 2 minutes. This short presentation is often requested at the start of the interview.
dailyTip.tip11: Find out your interviewer's name before the interview. Personalizing your exchanges creates a better connection.
dailyTip.tip12: Keep a dashboard of your applications to avoid duplicates and ensure effective tracking.
dailyTip.tip13: Highlight your soft skills with precise examples. Human skills are increasingly sought after.
dailyTip.tip14: Prepare short and long versions of your CV depending on the application type (spontaneous or in response to an offer).
dailyTip.tip15: Use Google Alerts to be informed of new offers in your field and news about your target companies.
dailyTip.tip16: Manage your e-reputation by checking what appears when searching your name on Google. Remove unprofessional content.
dailyTip.tip17: Attend networking events in your sector. Internal recommendations increase your chances of being hired.
dailyTip.tip18: Prepare questions about company culture during interviews. It shows you project yourself for the long term.
dailyTip.tip19: Regularly update your skills with online training. Mention your recent certifications.
dailyTip.tip20: Create several versions of your CV for different types of jobs while keeping coherence in your background.
dailyTip.tip21: Prepare for difficult questions like 'Tell me about your weaknesses' by turning your answers positively.
dailyTip.tip22: Use numbers to quantify your achievements: X% increase, Yâ‚¬ budget managed, team of Z people.
dailyTip.tip23: Arrive 10-15 minutes early to your interviews. It allows you to settle calmly and make a good impression.
dailyTip.tip24: Prepare a plan B for video interviews: test your connection, lighting, and have a backup phone number.
dailyTip.tip25: Send a thank-you message within 24 hours after the interview. It strengthens your motivation and professionalism.
dailyTip.tip26: Analyze job offers to identify the most sought-after skills in your sector and develop them.
dailyTip.tip27: Create a diverse contact network: former colleagues, professors, professionals in your sector.
dailyTip.tip28: Stay authentic during interviews. Recruiters can spot candidates who play a role rather than being themselves.
